ShouldersLVFrontRaise.name: Lever One Arm Front Raise
ShouldersLVFrontRaise.preparation: Stand with lever to side, fulcrum approximately shoulder height and handle just below hip. Grasp lever handle with elbow straight or slightly bent.
ShouldersLVFrontRaise.execution: Raise lever handle forward and upward until upper arm is well above horizontal. Lower and repeat. Repeat with opposite arm.
ShouldersLVFrontRaise.comments: Absolute height of movement may depend on individual range of motion. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement. Exercise is performed on Lever Extended Arm Lateral Raise Machine featuring long lever arms and handles attached to secondary levers as shown.

ShouldersLVReclinedShoulderPress.name: Lever Reclined Shoulder Press
ShouldersLVReclinedShoulderPress.preparation: Lie on back pad facing up. Grasp lever handles to each side with overhand grip.
ShouldersLVReclinedShoulderPress.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersLVReclinedShoulderPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.
ShouldersLVReclinedShoulderPress.synergists: supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, tricepsbrachii, trapeziuslower, serratusanterior

ShouldersLVReclinedShoulderPressParGrip.name: Lever Reclined Parallel Grip Shoulder Press
ShouldersLVReclinedShoulderPressParGrip.preparation: Lie on back pad facing up. Grasp parallel lever handles on each side.
ShouldersLVReclinedShoulderPressParGrip.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersLVReclinedShoulderPressParGrip.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.
ShouldersLVReclinedShoulderPressParGrip.synergists: trapeziusmiddle, pectoralisclavicular, tricepsbrachii, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, serratusanterior

ShouldersLVShoulderPress.name: Lever Shoulder Press
ShouldersLVShoulderPress.preparation: Set and grasp lever handles to each side with overhand grip.
ShouldersLVShoulderPress.execution: Press lever upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersLVShoulderPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.
ShouldersLVShoulderPress.synergists: supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, pectoralisclavicular, tricepsbrachii, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, serratusanterior

ShouldersLVShoulderPressParGrip.name: Lever Shoulder Press (parallel grip)
ShouldersLVShoulderPressParGrip.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp parallel bar grips in front of shoulders on each side.
ShouldersLVShoulderPressParGrip.execution: Press lever upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersLVShoulderPressParGrip.comments: Parallel grip can be used for variety or when flexibility does not permit standard overhand grip further back.
ShouldersLVShoulderPressParGrip.synergists: trapeziusmiddle, pectoralisclavicular, tricepsbrachii, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, serratusanterior

ShouldersLVAlternatingShoulderPress.name: Lever Alternating Shoulder Press
ShouldersLVAlternatingShoulderPress.preparation: Set and grasp lever handles to each side with overhand grip.
ShouldersLVAlternatingShoulderPress.execution: Press one lever upward until arm is extended overhead. Lower to original position. Repeat with opposite arm. Continue by alternating movement between arms.
ShouldersLVAlternatingShoulderPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.
ShouldersLVAlternatingShoulderPress.synergists: supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, pectoralisclavicular, tricepsbrachii, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, serratusanterior
